DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to increase childhood influenza vaccination rates using the FDA licensed influenza vaccines according to national guidelines in a randomized cluster trial in which primary care offices are randomized to intervention or control with the control group receiving the intervention in the second year.
DOC.brief_title: From Innovation to Solutions: Childhood Influenza Vaccination Planning
DOC.detailed_description: The investigators will conduct a stratified, randomized cluster trial of 20 diverse primary care practices to compare influenza vaccination rates in intervention and control sites. Intervention sites will use a package of newly developed and evidence-based techniques that will be tailored to their practice structure and culture, called the 4 Pillars Immunization Toolkit, in addition to receiving donated vaccine for early season vaccination. Control practices will not receive such assistance but will receive the intervention in the second year.
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criteria: For children: attendance at the selected health care center within the last year and age >/=6 months thru 18 years. For children: Severe egg allergy or allergy to influenza vaccine
